title: How to Clean a Cassette Deck

steps.title: Remove the tape from the deck.
steps.content: Remove the tape from the deck.

steps.title: Gather Isopropyl alcohol (70-80%)cotton swabs and a lens cleaning cloth.
steps.content: Gather Isopropyl alcohol (70-80%)cotton swabs and a lens cleaning cloth.

steps.title: Soak the cotton swab in the alcohol.
steps.content: Soak the cotton swab in the alcohol.

steps.title: Clean the heads.
steps.content: Clean the heads. Press fast forward and rewind so that the heads move. This will allow you to clean the heads more evenly.

steps.title: Clean the pinch roller.
steps.content: Clean the pinch roller. Press play so the roller is moving when you clean it. This part tends to be very grimy.

steps.title: Clean the capstan.
steps.content: Clean the capstan. This will also move when you press play. The capstan is the thin metal roller to the left of the pinch roller.

steps.title: Using the lens cloth, wipe out any other areas that appear dusty or dirty.
steps.content: Using the lens cloth, wipe out any other areas that appear dusty or dirty.

steps.title: Rewind the tape to the start, then fast forward to the end.
steps.content: Rewind the tape to the start, then fast forward to the end. This will smooth out the tape and any wrinkles that occurred when the tape came out should go away. Rewind and fast forward until the tape plays smoothly.
